comment: Dr. Coffey's class, especially if you are online, can be confusing but I have taken her twice and she's really sweet! The class is simple and easy, I just wish it was a little more organized but other than that, she's a great professor.

Dr. Coffey is the kindest professor! She cares about her students and wants them to do well. She is clear about deadlines but also allows extensions if you explain. I would recommend taking her, she is really great!

This is a nice lady. But her classroom is really boring, and she makes us do a lot of busy work on top of major assignments (W/ No Examples). A lot of us never knew what was going on in the classroom. She would talk for 3 hours straight. Her D2L is very sloppy and is hard to find assignments that you need. Please if you can ADVOID THIS PROFESSOR!

Easily one of the worst professors I have ever had. She is a kind person truly, but she has no idea what she says. In one sentence, she gave me three different due dates for the same assignment and gave everyone late grades. She is an easy grader so if you do the work you'll get an A. Would not recommend her at all if you like clear guidelines.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Lecture heavy

comment: This professor is very sweet but her class is so lecture-heavy. She will spend the entire 3 hours talking about nothing. The material she uses is extremely dated. I really don't think I learned anything from this class.

SO CONFUSING!!! All assignments are so vague and so are the due dates. She is SOO sweet but just not a good professor at all. Any questions you ask you will get the most confusing answer in the world and I feel like I left every class more confused than I was when I got there. DO NOT RECCOMMEND.

Easily the worst professor I have ever had. I have never been so confused in my life. This class has caused many tears and mental breakdowns ALL due to this professor. DO NOT TAKE. There are better options I promise. She is very unclear and does not ever answer any questions that she is asked. Please save yourself.

Dr. Coffey is a sweet person but a poor professor. I took her for ECE 3320 and ECE 3330, and while it was an easy A and she was an easy grader, the 3 hours I had to sit in her class were awful. She talked in circles and we did lots of busy work. She's nice and you'll get a good grade, but be ready to read and figure stuff out on your own.

dont let the rating scare you. shes so sweet/ caring. she loves what she does and you can tell. her class was full of confusion, but its nothing that will affect your grade in the long run. just some frustration. overall, i enjoyed my time and learned with her, just be sure to ask questions after class instead of in class for more clarification!

Professor Coffey is very caring and sweet. If you have a question she is quick in answering her emails. The textbook was used a lot in the semester. She is understanding if you have to turn in the work late just talk to her beforehand. The only thing I didn't like was her assignments were confusing so talk to her for clarification.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Caring

comment: These low ratings don't reflect Dr. Coffey as a teacher. She is very sweet and responds to emails quickly. The due dates and directions can sometimes be confusing, and the nature of this course is very work heavy. However, she is willing to extend due dates and is an easy grader. As long as you show up to class and do the work, you'll get an A.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Group projects

comment: Prepare to be confused about every single assignment. Never clear what exactly you need to turn in, and this class had the most assignments due out of all my classes. That being said she is an easy grader and due dates are flexible. She will lecture for the full 3 hours and you have to chose between taking a break or working in your groups.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: I actually had Professor Coffey for 3330 and 3305, and she is easily one of the best professors Ive ever had at Kennesaw State. She was always flexible with due dates, she graded very generously, and she is just an absolute sweetheart of a human being!
Overall, a good choice in a professor. Her lectures can be a bit boring, but there are only 4 assignments in the class, and she reviews them extensively before they are due.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Group projects--Lecture heavy

comment: This is hands-down the sweetest professor I've ever had. I'm really confused as to why her score is so low on here. She CAN be a little confusing and when you have questions, she tends to ramble before actually getting to your answer, but if you just email her, she tells you exactly what you need to hear. Very cute, very caring woman.

Caring professor, heavy course! Lectures can be confusing due to covering many assignments at once (not her fault, just how the course is). She wants you to succeed! It's a lot of work, but she is an easy grader (got a 100 on everything). Don't expect to like this class if you don't ask questions, pay attention, or aren't willing to do the work.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: This is the single worst professor I have ever had in my entire time in college. Her class is a complete mess. Her assignments make no sense and she is constantly changing the due dates and rules for the assignments. DO NOT TAKE This is a bad teacher.

Dr. Coffey is such a sweet woman and really cares about her students. As a professor, she can be very confusing with assignments and due dates. Most of the time this confusion wont affect your grade, but can be very frustrating. Overall this is a good choice for an easy A, but be prepared for frustration and confusing times.

Dr. Coffey is a sweet lady. A lot of people have previously complained about her not knowing how to use D2L or technology in general, but she has learned a lot. She speaks slowly, which can make it hard to focus, but I liked her a lot. She was really kind and understanding.

She's okay she isn't super clear with what she expects so be prepared to ask questions, but I will say she does try her best to explain things, overall her class is super easy and an easy A, she doesn't care really when you turn in the online work, just get it done and you will pass. Overall, she's a very nice women just talksin circles a lot.

Lordy. Her D2L is all over the place, very hard to follow. Multiple times, I finished an assignment, turned it in (the due date the night before) & when we got to class she added more criteria during class. Nothing is written out so its very hard to get an idea of what is expected for the assignment. AVOID HER CLASS! take another professor.

While she is a sweet woman, she is very disorganized in the classroom. Will present you with last minute assignments not on the syllabus and is unclear about most directions given. Still has not graded something due back in February and does not answer questions clearly when asked about assignments. Lots of busy/group work, would not suggest.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Group projects--Lecture heavy

comment: There is so much more to say about her than 350 characters will allow but in short. She is unclear with her criteria, assignment instructions, etc. When asked to clarify she does not give a definitive answer but just talks in circles until you give up asking the question. There are several assignments for this class all of which are ambiguous.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Group projects--So many papers

comment: Truly the worst class I have taken in the education program. I have no grades and too many assignments to count. She lectures forever and talks in circles. She will rpeat the same information 5 times and confuse you even more. Sweet person, HORRIBLE PROFESSOR. DO NOT TAKE
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: It is the end of March of spring semester and I still don't have any grades on major assignments from this teacher. She gives a lot of busy work, this class is the class I have the most assignments for. I haven't learned anything and she acts like we are second graders.

Her directions are very unclear. She does not answer any questions directly. We have 4 weeks of the semester left and I have not had any major assignments graded. The class requires alot of group work and she is very lecture heavy.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment: Dr. Coffey's is a very kind and caring professor. she works hard at helping her students understand the important impact of literature on literacy. I felt that she was trying to expose our class to the variety of technology tools available to assist us in the classroom with fostering a love of reading. Easy grader and only two big assignments.

Dr. Coffey is a great professor. She cares about students and wants to make the class as comfortable as possible. She is flexible on due dates and as long as you complete the assignments the class is an easy A. I would definitely take her class again.
Dr. Coffey is so sweet and understanding. 3320 is a lot of work but she understands that and is willing to help anyway she possibly can. KSUs teaching department needs more teachers like her!

Dr. Coffey is one of the sweetest lady's I've ever met! She is very understanding and cares so much about her students. No tests, just weekly discussion posts and 2 projects. She can be a little unclear about directions, but provides awesome rubrics and guided directions. As long as you follow those and don't question them too much you'll do fine!
rating_tags: GRADED BY FEW THINGS--Caring--Would take again

comment: She was unclear all semester and I went through the class confused about what was expected of us and she does not explain anything no matter how much you ask for clarity.

It's November and I still do not have 1 grade from this women. Very sweet, but so disorganized and you literally do not know how you're doing in the class. She's so nice, but I have learned nothing. Honestly, I feel unprepared to go into the field. Mixed emotions..

she is really nice and will work with whatever you bring to the table. definitely not clear about what she wants from us but attend class and do weekly things and you will be fine. Definitely taking her again.

Dr. Coffey is really hard to explain. She is a wonderful teacher. She is very nice and open to ideas, despite her old school appearance. I enjoyed taking this class very much. The only problem I had during this class is that i feel like she is not always clear on her expectations. I found myself emailing her a lot to clarify what she meant.

Dr. Coffey is the nicest lady you will ever meet. Sometimes her class can be frustrating, but she does everything she can to help you. There is not a lot of work, and the work is easy. Show up and do what your supposed to do, and you will be fine. I have had her twice, and would definitely take her again. Don't buy the textbook, just share.

Sweetest lady there is, but a terrible professor. She is so scatter brained all of the time and gets thrown off whenever you ask questions. Her lectures seem rehearsed so if you go off topic at all she gets flustered. No help whatsoever. You will never know what is due or what is expected for assignments. AVOID at all costs.

Holy Moly AVOID this teacher at all costs. You will never know what is going on at any given time during this course. "Process" & "In relation to" are her favorite things to say. She takes WEEKS to answer emails. If you ask any questions she tells you to hold on and then never answers. SO vague and disorganized. 4 months in, I've learned nothing

Angry with this class bc it was supposed to help me learn HOW to teach reading. She was always unclear with instructions and assignment names. One week it would be called the Tutorial process  then the next week it would be called the Tutorial plan. She loves the word "process" . She had to give us an A bc no one knew what to turn in. Frustrating.
Very unclear. Never replied to emails. Told the class last minute assignments.

Dr. Coffey is a very sweet lady; however, this class is one of the most irritating I have ever taken. She is very unclear as to what assignments are due or even what we should be doing in class. Half the time, students had to get together to try to figure out what we should be doing for tutoring and what we need to turn in. Would not take her again

I have never had a class where I was think confused about what in the world we are doing! She is very indirect with directions and changes her answer to how to do things every SINGLE time you ask her. No one in the class has any idea what to do or when things are due. She's a sweet lady, but all I'm learning is how NOT to teach a class. :(

Class mostly consists of learning vocabulary words. Miss class, come back, won't have missed any information all semester. Never went over guidelines for any classworkprojects and field experience notebook. Nothing learned except what not to do as a teacher. Any grades aren't revealed until last 2 weeks of semester. Avoid!!!

Took her during the four week summer session. She PILED on the work and gives you hardly any instruction which was super frustrating!!!She is super sweet but is hard when she gives you no instruction on any assignments!
Very sweet lady but you will not learn very much at all. Dont buy the book share with someone because you not use it! You will get an A if you show up and get your tutoring hours

She is a sweet lady but her class is very unclear. I don't know my grade at all and next week is finals. She knows her stuff but doesn't know how to teach it to us in a organized way. We used the Unlocking book a lot but the other two we never touched.
This is the worst professor I have ever had. If you have a choice, don't take her class. I did not learn a thing and she gives a ton of work. Class is boring.

I have no idea why people have given this professor great reviews. This is the most frustrating, un-clear education professor I've ever had. After you turn things in she will constantly tell you to turn OTHER things in that she hasn't told you about, & then acts like you are a mistaken moron for being clueless. I wish she was STRAIGHT FORWARD.

Love my Coffey! She is very knowledgable about material discussed in class and is excited about the reading process, which in turns get you excited to teach! This is the second class with her and I would def take her again.
SWEET Lady!  She is super nice and she cars about her students.. Lots of work though! Lots ---but easy grader.  She takes attendace and expects you to be there Every time! Take her if you can!

Excellent teacher. She loves teaching and helping you learn how to teach reading to young children. She is full of very practical information and you will enjoy this class with Dr. Coffey as your professor!
